security: The document discusses the reassignment of a career agent under AID cover, including their true name and Agency affiliation, potentially compromising their operational security. Quoting directly: "Inclusion of Subject on the Domestic Cover list is requested as noted below: When notified that cover has been established, Subject will be specifically authorized and instructed to conceal his Agency affiliation."
summary: A memorandum requests clearance for ZRJEWEL BACH's reassignment to Caracas under AID cover, and a form requests Lucien E. CORREN's inclusion on the Domestic Cover list to conceal his Agency affiliation.
summary_one_paragraph: This document consists of two parts: First, a memorandum dated 4 March 1965 from Desmond FitzGerald, Chief of the Western Hemisphere Division, requests security clearance for the reassignment of career agent ZRJEWEL BACH to Caracas, Venezuela, under AID cover. Second, a form dated 23 July 1968 requests Lucien E. CORREN's inclusion on the Domestic Cover list, authorizing him to conceal his Agency affiliation; the form also notes he was temporarily scheduled for duty under military cover.
title: Reassignment and Request for Domestic Cover
sender: Desmond FitzGerald, Chief, Western Hemisphere Division
